item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Laughter is the language of the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Let us forget with generosity those who cannot love us" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "To feel the love of people whom we love is a fire that feeds our life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Don't go far off, not even for a day, because I don't know how to say it - a day is long and I will be waiting for you, as in an empty station when the trains are parked off somewhere else, asleep.
Don't leave me, even for an hour, because then the little drops of anguish will all run together, the smoke that roams looking for a home will drift into me, choking my lost heart.
Oh, may your silhouette never dissolve on the beach, may your eyelids never flutter into the empty distance. Don't LEAVE me for a second, my dearest, because in that moment you'll have gone so far I'll wander mazily over all the earth, asking, will you come back? Will you leave me here, dying?" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Take bread away from me, if you wish, take air away, but do not take from me your laughter.
Do not take away the rose, the lance flower that you pluck, the water that suddenly bursts forth in joy, the sudden wave of silver born in you.
My struggle is harsh and I come back with eyes tired at times from having seen the unchanging earth, but when your laughter enters it rises to the sky seeking me and it opens for me all the doors of life.
My love, in the darkest hour your laughter opens, and if suddenly you see my blood staining the stones of the street, laugh, because your laughter will be for my hands like a fresh sword.
Next to the sea in the autumn, your laughter must raise its foamy cascade, and in the spring, love, I want your laughter like the flower I was waiting for, the blue flower, the rose of my echoing country.
Laugh at the night, at the day, at the moon, laugh at the twisted streets of the island, laugh at this clumsy fool who loves you, but when I open my eyes and close them, when my steps go, when my steps return, deny me bread, air, light, spring, but never your laughter. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: parisa add a quote by Santosh Kalwar
item.description: "I was smiling yesterday,I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow.Simply because life is too short to cry for anything." -- Santosh Kalwar

item.title: parisa add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: parisa add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: parisa add a quote by Herbert Samuels
item.description: "The world is like a mirror; frown at it, and it frowns at you. Smile and it smiles, too" -- Herbert Samuels

item.title: parisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: parisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: parisa add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: parisa add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: parisa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: parisa add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: parisa add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: parisa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Don't handicap your children by making their lives easy." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: parisa add a quote by Steve Maraboli
item.description: "Happiness is not the absence of problems; it's the ability to deal with them." -- Steve Maraboli

item.title: parisa add a quote by Molière
item.description: "The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it." -- Molière

item.title: parisa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: parisa add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: parisa add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept." -- George Carlin

item.title: parisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "You believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: parisa add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: parisa add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer." -- Ellen DeGeneres
